claim_card.claim: For classical turbulence, Φ(t) is defined as Φ(t)=Ṡ / (Q̇/T), with Ṡ(t_k)=(2ν/Δ̄)⟨ω^2⟩ and Q̇(t)=ε(t) from third-order structure functions, with T≡⟨v^2⟩/3.
claim_card.test_hook: Compute Φ(t) on an open DNS dataset; verify numerical stability and compare Φ(t) behavior across Reynolds number and filtering choices.
claim_card.evidence_excerpt: Entropy production rate ... Dissipative flux ... Φ(t) = Ṡ / (Q̇/T)
